articles.description: Follow live text commentary of the second day of pre-season testing at the Bahrain International Circuit.
articles.title: Ferrari's Sainz quickest on day two of testing in Bahrain

articles.description: Two years on from Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Elina Svitolina represents her country on court and in the conflict.
articles.title: Elina Svitolina: The star and the kids who play on through horror

articles.description: A court in Spain has sentenced Alves, who played for Barcelona and Brazil, to four and a half years.
articles.title: Dani Alves trial: Ex-Brazil player guilty of nightclub rape

articles.description: England make five changes for their Six Nations match with Scotland on Saturday as George Furbank starts at full-back.
articles.title: Furbank in at full-back as England make five changes

articles.description: Real Madrid midfielder Toni Kroos has come out of international football retirement for Euro 2024 hosts Germany.
articles.title: Kroos announces Germany international comeback

articles.description: The negative reaction to England's third Test defeat by India was disproportionate and they will not change their approach for the fourth Test. says Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: 'Not every Test has to put Bazball on trial'

articles.description: Bayer Leverkusen boss Xabi Alonso "has nothing new to say" amid speculation linking him with Bayern Munich and Liverpool.
articles.title: Alonso tight-lipped about Liverpool & Bayern links

articles.description: Blair Kinghorn, Kyle Steyn and Matt Fagerson will start for Scotland in Saturday's Calcutta Cup meeting with England.
articles.title: Kinghorn, Steyn & Ritchie return for Scotland

articles.description: Everton manager Sean Dyche says the club hopes to hear the outcome of its appeal against a 10-point deduction "around the end of the month".
articles.title: Everton hope appeal is settled 'around end of month'

articles.description: Manager Jurgen Klopp feels Chelsea are "definitely" favourites for Sunday's EFL Cup final but says a depleted Liverpool "will go for it" after they beat Luton to extend their Premier League lead.
articles.title: 'As long as we have 11 players, we will go for it' - Klopp
